### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22981](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22981) (doc: Fix incorrect C++ named args by MarcoFalke)

If you consid
Seems dangerous to call a test-only method `context`, a name that implies it can be used in production code. Wouldn't it be better to pick an ugly name like getMockedContext or getTestContext?

> Seems dangerous to call a test-only method `context`, a name that implies it can be used in production code. Wouldn't it be better to pick an ugly name like getMockedContext or getTestContext?\n\nI don't really consider it a test-only method. The method is only currently used from tests, but it's not returning a fake context, and I think it could be legitimately be called outside of tests. For
In that case the "Useful for testing" docstring can be removed? Any function is "Useful for testing" if it is called by the tests.

> In that case the "Useful for testing" docstring can be removed? Any function is "Useful for testing" if it is called by the tests.\n\nI guess I would replace "Useful for testing" with "Mostly useful for testing" because like you say any function can be useful for testing.
